name: UrbanKisaan
headline: Reimagining Food through Farming
description: We've built over last 4 years on precision farming, hydroponics and core agronomy. We make vertical farming affordable and accessible to everyone.

founders.name: Vihari Kanukollu, Founder
founders.description: Forbes 30 under 30 Asia, Co-Founder and CEO @urbankisaan. Farmer at heart.

generated_description:
UrbanKisaan is an innovative agricultural company based in Hyderabad, India, that was founded in 2018. Its mission? *Reimagining Food through Farming*. Think of them as champions of vertical farming—bringing precision, efficiency, and sustainability to the table. They’ve spent the last four years perfecting techniques in hydroponics and agronomy, making vertical farming not just a niche endeavor but a widely accessible solution for urban communities.

With a team of 53 passionate individuals, UrbanKisaan aims to create local farms globally while utilizing just a fraction of the water and land compared to traditional farming. This is a big deal, especially in a world facing significant food security challenges.

One of their standout initiatives is the *Speed Breeding Program*, which optimizes growth cycles and enhances crop quality. They focus on nutrient-dense plants grown sustainably, blending advanced plant science with cutting-edge agricultural technology. This approach doesn’t just aim to feed people; it seeks to do so in a way that preserves our planet for future generations.

UrbanKisaan is a graduate from Y Combinator’s Winter 2020 batch, which adds a level of credibility and potential for growth to their venture. Recently, they forged a partnership with NKK Investments to revolutionize hydroponic practices across the Middle East—an indication of their expanding impact on global agricultural practices.

So if you're looking to get involved with UrbanKisaan, you might check out their website [UrbanKisaan.com](https://www.urbankisaan.com) to learn more about their offerings, which include options for building personal farms and subscribing to their produce. They’re on a mission, and it’s one that’s both innovative and necessary. Vertical farming isn’t just the future—it’s a smarter way to think about our food systems today.
